findings.title: State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure the value cannot be changed after it has been set and decrease gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.

findings.title: Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: In Solidity, dead code is code that is written in the contract, but is never executed or reached during normal contract execution.

findings.title: Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration. This is usually happening either if it has not been declared yet or if the variable has been declared in a different scope.

findings.title: Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of prediction.

findings.title: Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: The transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful according to the ERC20 specification, otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
